body.directions: Read the phrases in Chinese, and then answer the question that follows.

body.quiz: Which of the following words best describes the action indicated by the word presented?
body.answer: Image of someone who is driving a car©iStock
options: Image of someone who is climbing a mountain©iStock
Image of someone who is riding a bike©iStock
Image of someone who is riding a train©iStock
body.correct: You got it! 开车 kāichē means driving a car. Of the four choices, you've selected the one in which someone's riding in a car.
body.incorrect: Very close. Review the word several more times to understand its meaning. Sound it out if you need to. Then, match it to the images in the choices to see which one makes the most sense.

body.quiz: Which of the following falls in the same category as the word presented?
body.answer: Audio for 地铁 dìtiě (subway)
options: Audio for 医院 yīyuàn (hospital)
Audio for 瑜伽 yújiā (yoga)
Audio for 面包 miànbāo (bread)
body.correct: Fabulous job! 摩托车 mótuóchē means “motorcycle,” and it’s a mode of transportation. So is 地铁 dìtiě (subway).
body.incorrect: Not quite. Review the word several more times to understand its meaning. Then consider the nature of the item it indicates, listen to the choices, and then consider which item shares the same nature.

body.quiz: Which of the following single-character words can be reasonably placed before the word presented?
body.correct: Terrific job! 转 zhuǎn means “to turn,” and it works with a direction word such as 左 zuǒ (left). Remember that the to turn direction word needs to be placed before 转 zhuǎn (to turn), not after.
body.incorrect: Oops.First identify the meaning of the word in the audio. Then consider which character in the options can form a meaningful phrase with it. Pay extra attention to the shapes of the characters in the choices as they are very similar.

body.quiz: Which of the following sentences can be best completed by the word in the audio?
options: 他叫____名字? Tā jiào ____ míngzi?
body.correct: How excellent! The word 怎么 zěnme means “how,” and it’s often placed before the verb in a sentence to form a “how to” question. Later in this lesson you will learn more about how to use this word.
body.incorrect: Not quite…Think about the meaning of the word in the audio. Then fit it in the four sentences in the choices to see which one makes the most sense.
